SUNIL THOMAS, J.
Crl.M.C.No.5273 of 2016
Dated this the 9" day of January, 2017
ORDER

Petitioner herein is the sole accused in Crime No.391 of
2008 of Kondoitty Police Station for offences punishable under
sections 419, 468 and 471 of Indian Penal Code and Section
12(1)(b) of the Passport Act, 1967.

2. The crux of the prosecution case is that the petitioner
herein had obtained a passport with forged documents. When this
was detected, crime was registered. The investigation is still
pending. According to the petitioner herein, the long delay in filing
the final report causes irreparable injury to him. He has now been
offered a job abroad. Hence, he sought permission of the court
below to apply for a fresh passport. Court below, by Annexure-B
order dismissed the application on the reasoning that the
investigation is still going on and if the petitioner is permitted to
leave abroad, that is likely to hamper the investigation. Learned
Public Prosecutor submitted that the petitioner herein is alleged to
have changed photograph in his passport and hence the question of
his identity may also arise. It is further submitted that the

documents have been forwarded to the FSL for expert opinion.

3. Evidently, the disputed passport is with the investigating
agency. Investigation has not reached its final stage in spite of long
lapse of time. Petitioner herein may not be restrained on account of
pendency of the case, which would affect his livelihood. In the light
of above, I am inclined to set aside the impugned order. The
petitioner herein is permitted to apply for a fresh passport, which
may be issued by the authorities, if otherwise permissible, for a
period not less than two years. It is made clear that this permission
is only for the limited purpose for applying for a passport. For the
purpose of permission to leave the country, petitioner herein shall
move the court below with appropriate application detailing the
country which he proposes to visit, period of his stay there, purpose,
his contact details and also the period during which he proposes to
leave the country. Court below shall consider it and permit him to
leave the country for a period of one year at a stretch.

Crl.M.C is disposed of as above.
Sd/-
